snippet: A half-dozen American entrepreneurs are reviving the craft of making malt on a small scale, and national craft brewers have come calling.
abstract: Some American entrepreneurs are reviving the craft of making malt on a small scale, and it appears poised to lubricate the already explosive growth of craft beer; because maltsters, as they call themselves, occupy a middle ground between grain growers and brewers, they are well positioned to help revive interest in heirloom and long-forgotten grains with distinctive flavors and aromas.
lead_paragraph: A half-dozen American entrepreneurs are reviving the craft of making malt on a small scale, and national craft brewers have come calling.

headline.seo: Small Malting Companies Revive a Dormant Craft
headline.main: Malters Bring Terroir to the Beer Bottle
headline.print_headline: Malters Bring Terroir to the Beer Bottle
